verses.kjv: Moreover the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD's message came to me:

verses.kjv: Go and cry in the ears of Jerusalem, saying, Thus saith the LORD; I remember thee, the kindness of thy youth, the love of thine espousals, when thou wentest after me in the wilderness, in a land that was not sown.
verses.ct: "Go and proclaim this so that Jerusalem can hear it. The LORD says: I remember your devotion when you were young, your love during our early relationship together, how you followed me through the wilderness, through a land where nothing grew."

verses.kjv: Israel was holiness unto the LORD, and the firstfruits of his increase: all that devour him shall offend; evil shall come upon them, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "Israel was set apart for the LORD, the first portion of his harvest. Everyone who consumed them brought guilt on themselves; disaster came upon them," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Hear ye the word of the LORD, O house of Jacob, and all the families of the house of Israel:
verses.ct: Listen to the LORD's message, descendants of Jacob — all the families of the nation of Israel:

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, What iniquity have your fathers found in me, that they are gone far from me, and have walked after vanity, and are become vain?
verses.ct: The LORD says this: "What fault did your ancestors find in me that they drifted so far away from me? They chased after worthless idols and became worthless themselves."

verses.kjv: Neither said they, Where is the LORD that brought us up out of the land of Egypt, that led us through the wilderness, through a land of deserts and of pits, through a land of drought, and of the shadow of death, through a land that no man passed through, and where no man dwelt?
verses.ct: "They never asked, 'Where is the LORD who brought us up out of Egypt, who guided us through the wilderness — through a land of deserts and ravines, through a land of drought and deep darkness, through a land no one travels and no one lives in?'"

verses.kjv: And I brought you into a plentiful country, to eat the fruit thereof and the goodness thereof; but when ye entered, ye defiled my land, and made mine heritage an abomination.
verses.ct: "I brought you into a fertile land to enjoy its fruit and its abundance. But when you arrived, you made my land filthy and turned my inheritance into something disgusting."

verses.kjv: The priests said not, Where is the LORD? and they that handle the law knew me not: the pastors also transgressed against me, and the prophets prophesied by Baal, and walked after things that do not profit.
verses.ct: "The priests never asked, 'Where is the LORD?' Those who taught the law didn't know me. The leaders rebelled against me, and the prophets prophesied in Baal's name, chasing after things that are completely useless."

verses.kjv: Wherefore I will yet plead with you, saith the LORD, and with your children’s children will I plead.
verses.ct: "Therefore I will bring charges against you," declares the LORD, "and I will bring charges against your grandchildren as well."

verses.kjv: For pass over the isles of Chittim, and see; and send unto Kedar, and consider diligently, and see if there be such a thing.
verses.ct: "Cross over to the shores of Chittim and look around. Send someone to Kedar and investigate carefully. See if anything like this has ever happened."

verses.kjv: Hath a nation changed their gods, which are yet no gods? but my people have changed their glory for that which doth not profit.
verses.ct: "Has any nation ever traded its gods for different ones — even though their gods aren't real? Yet my people have traded their glory for something completely worthless."

verses.kjv: Be astonished, O ye heavens, at this, and be horribly afraid, be ye very desolate, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "Be shocked at this, you heavens! Shudder with horror and be utterly appalled," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: For my people have committed two evils; they have forsaken me the fountain of living waters, and hewed them out cisterns, broken cisterns, that can hold no water.
verses.ct: "My people have done 2 terrible things: They have abandoned me — the spring of living water — and they have dug their own wells, cracked wells that can't even hold water."

verses.kjv: Is Israel a servant? is he a homeborn slave? why is he spoiled?
verses.ct: "Is Israel a slave? Was he born into slavery? Then why has he become everyone's prey?"

verses.kjv: The young lions roared upon him, and yelled, and they made his land waste: his cities are burned without inhabitant.
verses.ct: "Lions have roared at him and growled loudly. They have turned his land into a wasteland. His cities are burned and emptied of people."

verses.kjv: Also the children of Noph and Tahapanes have broken the crown of thy head.
verses.ct: "The people of Noph and Tahapanes have cracked your skull."

verses.kjv: Hast thou not procured this unto thyself, in that thou hast forsaken the LORD thy God, when he led thee by the way?
verses.ct: "Haven't you brought this on yourself by abandoning the LORD your God while he was leading you along the way?"

verses.kjv: And now what hast thou to do in the way of Egypt, to drink the waters of Sihor? or what hast thou to do in the way of Assyria, to drink the waters of the river?
verses.ct: "So now, why are you heading to Egypt to drink from the waters of Sihor? And why are you heading to Assyria to drink from the waters of the Euphrates?"

verses.kjv: Thine own wickedness shall correct thee, and thy backslidings shall reprove thee: know therefore and see that it is an evil thing and bitter, that thou hast forsaken the LORD thy God, and that my fear is not in thee, saith the Lord GOD of hosts.
verses.ct: "Your own wickedness will discipline you, and your unfaithfulness will punish you. Recognize and understand how terrible and bitter it is that you have abandoned the LORD your God, and that deep reverence for me has no place in you," declares the Lord GOD of hosts.

verses.kjv: For of old time I have broken thy yoke, and burst thy bands; and thou saidst, I will not transgress; when upon every high hill and under every green tree thou wanderest, playing the harlot.
verses.ct: "Long ago I broke your yoke and tore off your chains. You said, 'I won't disobey!' Yet on every high hill and under every green tree, you sprawled out like a prostitute."

verses.kjv: Yet I had planted thee a noble vine, wholly a right seed: how then art thou turned into the degenerate plant of a strange vine unto me?
verses.ct: "I planted you as a choice vine, entirely from the best seed. So how have you turned into a wild, corrupt vine that is foreign to me?"

verses.kjv: For though thou wash thee with nitre, and take thee much soap, yet thine iniquity is marked before me, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.ct: "Even if you scrub yourself with strong soap and use plenty of cleanser, the stain of your guilt is still visible to me," declares the Lord GOD.

verses.kjv: How canst thou say, I am not polluted, I have not gone after Baalim? see thy way in the valley, know what thou hast done: thou art a swift dromedary traversing her ways;
verses.ct: "How can you claim, 'I'm not contaminated; I haven't chased after the Baals'? Look at what you've done in the valley — face what you've been doing! You're like a restless young camel running wildly in every direction,"

verses.kjv: A wild ass used to the wilderness, that snuffeth up the wind at her pleasure; in her occasion who can turn her away? all they that seek her will not weary themselves; in her month they shall find her.
verses.ct: "like a wild donkey at home in the desert, sniffing the wind in her desire. When she's in heat, who can restrain her? No one who pursues her needs to exhaust himself — at mating time she's easy to find."

verses.kjv: Withhold thy foot from being unshod, and thy throat from thirst: but thou saidst, There is no hope: no; for I have loved strangers, and after them will I go.
verses.ct: "Stop running until your sandals wear out and your throat is parched with thirst! But you said, 'It's no use! No — I love foreign gods, and I'm going to keep chasing them.'"

verses.kjv: As the thief is ashamed when he is found, so is the house of Israel ashamed; they, their kings, their princes, and their priests, and their prophets,
verses.ct: "Like a thief who feels shame only when caught, the people of Israel are disgraced — they, their kings, their officials, their priests, and their prophets."

verses.kjv: Saying to a stock, Thou art my father; and to a stone, Thou hast brought me forth: for they have turned their back unto me, and not their face: but in the time of their trouble they will say, Arise, and save us.
verses.ct: "They say to a piece of wood, 'You are my father,' and to a stone, 'You gave birth to me.' They have turned their backs to me instead of their faces. But when trouble comes, they cry out, 'Get up and rescue us!'"

verses.kjv: But where are thy gods that thou hast made thee? let them arise, if they can save thee in the time of thy trouble: for according to the number of thy cities are thy gods, O Judah.
verses.ct: "So where are the gods you made for yourselves? Let them get up and save you when you're in trouble — if they can! Because you have as many gods as you have cities, Judah."

verses.kjv: Wherefore will ye plead with me? ye all have transgressed against me, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "Why are you arguing with me? Every one of you has rebelled against me," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: In vain have I smitten your children; they received no correction: your own sword hath devoured your prophets, like a destroying lion.
verses.ct: "I punished your children, but it did no good — they refused to accept correction. Your own sword has killed your prophets like a ravenous lion."

verses.kjv: O generation, see ye the word of the LORD. Have I been a wilderness unto Israel? a land of darkness? wherefore say my people, We are lords; we will come no more unto thee?
verses.ct: "You people of this generation, pay attention to the LORD's message! Have I been like a desert to Israel? Have I been a land of total darkness? Then why do my people say, 'We're free to roam — we won't come back to you anymore'?"

verses.kjv: Can a maid forget her ornaments, or a bride her attire? yet my people have forgotten me days without number.
verses.ct: "Does a young woman forget her jewelry, or a bride her wedding dress? Yet my people have forgotten me for more days than anyone can count."

verses.kjv: Why trimmest thou thy way to seek love? therefore hast thou also taught the wicked ones thy ways.
verses.ct: "How skillfully you plan your path to chase after lovers! Because of this, you've even taught wicked women your techniques."

verses.kjv: Also in thy skirts is found the blood of the souls of the poor innocents: I have not found it by secret search, but upon all these.
verses.ct: "On your clothes is found the blood of innocent poor people. You didn't catch them breaking in — yet it's on all of them."

verses.kjv: Yet thou sayest, Because I am innocent, surely his anger shall turn from me. Behold, I will plead with thee, because thou sayest, I have not sinned.
verses.ct: "Still you say, 'I'm innocent — surely his anger has turned away from me.' Look — I am going to judge you precisely because you claim, 'I haven't sinned.'"

verses.kjv: Why gaddest thou about so much to change thy way? thou also shalt be ashamed of Egypt, as thou wast ashamed of Assyria.
verses.ct: "Why do you run around so much, switching your alliances? You will be disappointed by Egypt just as you were disappointed by Assyria."

verses.kjv: Yea, thou shalt go forth from him, and thine hands upon thine head: for the LORD hath rejected thy confidences, and thou shalt not prosper in them.
verses.ct: "You will also leave that alliance with your hands on your head in shame, because the LORD has rejected those you trust, and you will not succeed through them."
